frqParts.text: Let f be a function whose domain is the closed interval [0,5]. The graph of f is shown above. Let <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mfrac> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow> </mrow> </mstyle></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaiaacI cacaWG4bGaaiykaiabg2da9maapedabaGaamOzaiaacIcacaWG0bGa aiykaiaadsgacaWG0baaleaacaaIWaaabaWaaSaaaeaacaWG4baaba GaaGOmaaaacqGHRaWkcaaIZaaaniabgUIiYdaaaa@45A9@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. (a) Find the domain of h.
(c) At what x is h ( x ) a minimum? Show the analysis that leads to your conclusion.

topic.text: 5.5: Using the Candidates Test to Determine Absolute (Global) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
